spatial_accuracy.notes: Overall room zoning is roughly similar (left bedroom, central hall/bath/utility, right bedroom, open living/dining/kitchen), but multiple spatial mismatches: interior wall runs and offsets don’t match the 2D plan (notably the hall-to-living boundary and the left-side entry corridor shape). Several door locations/orientations are incorrect or simplified, and most exterior windows shown on the 2D plan are missing in the 3D. Room proportions are noticeably distorted: the central open area is enlarged while the top rooms (bath/office) and left bedroom appear resized/reshaped.

structural_fidelity.notes: Wall thickness is mostly consistent, but adjacency and openings are not faithfully embedded: doors appear as generic panels and do not consistently correspond to the plan’s swing positions. Adjacency is partially preserved (bath and office along the top-middle, bedrooms at left/right), but key partition geometry (living-area enclosure/partial wall) deviates. No clear extra rooms, but several planned architectural elements (windows, some partitions) are omitted, reducing fidelity.

furniture_mapping.notes: Furniture is only loosely mapped. Left bedroom in the plan has two single beds; the 3D shows only one (missing one bed) and simplified storage. Right bedroom desk/workstation shown in plan is missing/simplified. Living room arrangement differs (plan shows sectional + chair + TV placement within a defined nook; 3D places seating more openly with different partition context). Kitchen layout is simplified and not placed/arranged to match the 2D counters/appliances.

aesthetic_quality.notes: Render is clean with consistent materials, decent lighting, and readable composition. Camera is isometric-like but not strictly orthographic (perspective/foreshortening present). Geometry is mostly clean with minimal artifacts; however, architectural simplifications (missing windows/doors details) reduce clarity relative to a verification-grade model.

detected_errors.description: Interior wall alignment mismatch: the hall/living boundary and the left-side corridor/entry partitioning do not match the 2D plan’s wall offsets and shapes.
Door placement/orientation errors: multiple doors do not match the 2D plan’s exact positions and swing orientations (bath/office/right-bedroom openings appear simplified or shifted).
Missing windows: several exterior windows visible in the 2D plan (top wall segments and right-bedroom/kitchen-side openings) are absent in the 3D render.
Proportion distortion: central open living/dining area is oversized relative to the plan, while top-middle rooms (bath/office) and the left bedroom appear resized/reshaped.
Missing furniture element: the left bedroom shows only one bed in 3D, while the 2D plan clearly shows two single beds.
Missing/incorrect furniture element: right-bedroom desk/work area shown in the 2D plan is not represented accurately in the 3D render.
Kitchen fixture placement mismatch: 3D kitchen counters/appliances are simplified and do not align with the 2D plan’s counter run and sink placement along the bottom-right.
